title: From the Ashes was excellent
body:
It seems that the story wasn't supposed to be released yet, but I'll commend it for its quality.

Kegan is a well-written character. From his fiery interactions with his mother, to his love for Zvanna and his vengeance against Rygann and the village.

Kegan's successfully been turned into something more than a mere vessel for Brand's fury.

His final interaction with Ryze was very good.

Kegan's a barbarian who managed to frighten the archmage teaching him with a simple question. He's both wise and ignorant. A child, the son of a reaver, and a genius who outwitted his master with pure logic. Their dialogue was the best part of the story, personally. This type of writing needs to continue.

Kegan is Brand, I bet that's what it is.

I suspect that what happens in the future of this story is that Kegan got his hands on the fire world rune, probably before he and Ryze could have that conversation Ryze said they weren't ready for. And it consumes him because he doesn't know how to stop it from being used - remember Ryze said that magic wants to be used? It's probably some sort of primordial force, with consciousness, that wants to be used.

That's my theory anyways.

Kegan studies with Ryze but never learns his limitations. Ryze specifically states that it's harder to stop using magic than it is to use it.

Whether "Brand" is a primordial entity trapped in one or a sentient world rune is unknown, but Kegan will try to control it and be swallowed by its power - which is how he becomes the burning humanoid who Ryze will most likely have to destroy.
